questionText: What is the full meaning of the acronym HTML?
explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages and defining their structure and content.

questionText: What is the purpose of <!DOCTYPE html> at the start of an HTML file?
options: Tells the browser this is HTML5
explanation: <!DOCTYPE html> declares the document as HTML5, helping browsers render the page properly. It should be the first line in any HTML document.

questionText: Which section contains all the visible content of a webpage?
explanation: The <body> section holds all visible content like text, images, and links. The <head> contains metadata, while <html> wraps everything.

questionText: Which attribute specifies where a hyperlink should navigate to?
explanation: The 'href' (hypertext reference) attribute sets the link destination. Example: Visit. 'src' is for images.

questionText: What does the 'id' attribute do in HTML?
options: To add comments to the HTML
To style multiple elements with the same styles
To create a unique identifier for a single element
explanation: The 'id' attribute assigns a unique identifier to ONE element. It's used with CSS, JavaScript, or anchor links. Each id must be unique per page.

questionText: Which attribute lets you assign CSS classes to an HTML element?
explanation: The 'class' attribute applies CSS classes. Multiple elements can share classes, and elements can have multiple classes. Example: <div class="card featured">.

questionText: In which section should you place the <title> tag?
explanation: The <title> tag belongs in <head> and sets the page title in browser tabs and search results. Example: <head><title>Home Page</title></head>

questionText: What is the standard file extension for HTML files?
explanation: While .htm is valid, .html is the preferred standard extension. The .htm extension comes from old systems limited to 3-character extensions.

questionText: Which heading tag creates the largest heading?
explanation: h1 is the largest heading, representing the main page title. Headings range from h1 (largest) to h6 (smallest).

questionText: Which attribute tells the browser where to find an image file?
explanation: The 'src' (source) attribute points to the image location. 'href' is for hyperlinks.

questionText: Which tag creates a line break?
explanation: is self-closing and creates a line break without starting a new paragraph. Useful for addresses, poems, or lyrics.

questionText: What default filename do web servers look for as the homepage?
explanation: Web servers automatically serve 'index.html' when accessing a directory. Visiting 'site.com/' loads 'site.com/index.html' by default.

questionText: How do you make a link open in a new tab?
explanation: target='_blank' opens links in new tabs/windows. Example: New tab. Other values include _self (same tab).

questionText: How do you write comments in HTML?
explanation: HTML comments use <!-- comment -->. They're invisible to users but visible in source code. // is JavaScript, /* */ is CSS, # is Python.

questionText: Is it possible to use multiple attributes in a single HTML tag?
options: Yes, multiple attributes can be used separated by spaces
No, only one attribute per element
Only if they are the same type
explanation: Elements can have multiple space-separated attributes. Each provides different information.
